intro: Sphaeralcea capituliflora, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It has a compact, globular shape with hairy leaves and is adapted to arid environments. Sphaeralcea capituliflora is often found in sandy soils and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
